remarks: Two ways to express "the sum of ` A ( j , k ) ` over the triangular region ` 0 <_ j ` , ` 0 <_ k ` , ` j + k <_ N ` ."  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Jul-2014.)
statement:
fsum0diag2.1 $e |- ( x = k -> B = A ) $.
fsum0diag2.2 $e |- ( x = ( k - j ) -> B = C ) $.
fsum0diag2.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( j e. ( 0 ... N ) /\ k e. ( 0 ... ( N - j ) ) ) ) -> A e. CC ) $.
fsum0diag2 $p |- ( ph -> sum_ j e. ( 0 ... N ) sum_ k e. ( 0 ... ( N - j ) ) A = sum_ k e. ( 0 ... N ) sum_ j e. ( 0 ... k ) C ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B k $.
$d C x $.
$d N j k x $.
$d j k ph $.
